text: Ryan Powell Shore (born December 29, 1974) is a Canadian composer, songwriter, conductor, music producer and music director for film, television, virtual reality, records, games, concerts and theater. == Early life == Shore was born in Toronto, Ontario to Jewish parents Michael Shore and Verna Hope Libman. Shore is the nephew of composer Howard Shore. == Music career == Shore was Assistant Music Director and Contributing Composer/Arranger/Orchestrator for the 87th Academy Awards, where he worked with artists Lady Gaga, John Legend, Adam Levine, Anna Kendrick, Common, Tim McGraw, Jack Black, Neil Patrick Harris and Jennifer Hudson. == Other websites == * Category:1974 births Category:Canadian composers Category:Canadian Jews Category:Jewish musicians Category:Living people Category:Movie score composers Category:Musicians from Toronto
title: Ryan Shore
